**Decided to accept the challenge and give it a go!:**

**Rook - The Last Bastion**

**Innate:** Hold The Line

**Passive:** While Rook is within 500 range of a tower, both the tower and Rook will take 15% reduced damage.
**Active:** Rook can target an allied tower within 500 range of him, melding him into the tower. He assumes control of the tower for up to 10 seconds, and can target any enemy within the tower's attack range. While commanding the tower, 20% of all incoming damage to the tower gets redirected towards Rook's health bar instead. If Rook is currently at, or falls below 5% health, he cannot command a tower and/or he is ejected from the tower.

**Cooldown:** 180 seconds (Not affected by Cooldown Reduction)
***
**First Ability:** Landslide

**Active:** Rook slams and rips up the ground in front of him, dealing 60/110/160/210/260 (+0.5 Attack Damage, 2.0/2.5/3.0/3.5/4.0% Rook's Maximum Health) physical damage to all enemies caught in the line skillshot. The ground under the skillshot becomes unstable for 6 seconds, slowing enemy's movement speed by 20/22/24/26/28% while they are on it.

**Cooldown:** 15/13.5/12/10.5/9 seconds.
**Mana Cost:** 80/75/70/65/60 mana.
***
**Second Ability:** Stoneform

**Passive:** For every 25 armour Rook has, he gains 5/7.5/10/12.5/15% base health regeneration. For every 25 magic resist Rook has, he gains 5/7.5/10/12.5/15% base mana regeneration.
**Active:** Rook turns his skin to stone, reducing incoming damage by 34/40/46/52/58% for 3.5 seconds and increasing incoming healing effectiveness by 12%. He cannot basic attack or cast spells during this time and moves 20% slower.

**Cooldown:** 24/23/22/21/20 seconds.
**Mana Cost:** 50 at all ranks.
***
**Third Ability:** Seismic Roar

**Active:** Rook roars loudly, targetting the ground in a cone in front of him. The ground is ripped up and shredded, damaging and affecting enemies caught in the roar. Enemies within 200 range of the roar take 80/125/170/215/260 (+0.4 Attack Damage, 5% Rook's Maximum Health) physical damage and are knocked back to 250 range away from Rook. Enemies between 201 and 450 range of the roar take 60/100/140/180/220 (+0.25 Attack Damage, 3% Rook's Maximum Health) physical damage and are slowed by 50% for 1 second.

**Cooldown:** 15/14/13/12/11 seconds.
**Mana Cost: 65 at all ranks.
***
**Ultimate Ability:** Unrelenting Fortress

**Active:** Rook's body becomes stone and moulds into a giant bounder. After a 0.5 second delay, Rook charges in a straight line as a boulder. Any enemies hit by Rook take 100/175/250 (+0.35/0.40/0.45 Attack Damage, +3/5/7% Rook's Maximum Health) physical damage and are knocked aside. After being knocked aside, enemies are stunned for 0.75 seconds. Rook will end the charge at the end of his maximum range or if he collides with a wall. As he rolls past, he leaves behind a trail of unstable ground that slows enemies on it by 20/24/28%.

**Cooldown:** 110/90/70 seconds.
**Mana Cost:** 110/100/90 mana.

Tbh blitz does a good amount of damage. Thresh does too, same with naut and Taric's E has a pretty good scailing. His passive basically helps him attack more..That's why Taric and thresh can be played effectively as a top lane bruiser or AP naut and blitz as a troll midlaner.

Here's the problem: If you have a tank champ without much AD/AP of any sort then how does that champ win a lane?  Are we limiting them to support only? Pretty much any champion can be played in multiple roles effectively (some less effective than others).  If we make him a full on tank that ONLY absorbs damage, then he has no way to stop the enemy from pushing the lane against him repeatedly.  If the tank champ was in a 1 on 1 he would lose.  Yea, he could tank a ton of damage, but without being able to deal any damage the enemy has no reason to run away.

We already have some really tanky champs: {{champion:201}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:33}}  just to name 3 off the top of my head.

It's not meant to win a lane like soraka or Janna aren't really able to win a lane by themselves. They are meant to tank and cc, Braum, Alistar, and Rammus already struggle to take damage from 5 other champions lategame at level 18, while this champion has more health than the average 3k health tank because of base stats to last way longer.

The thing is, tanks aren't really supposed to 1v5. They are supposed to be able to survive, just long enough for their team to murder the enemies. That's why tanks dive in. They don't necessarily survive, they make the play, and hope their team follows up. If their team does, then they often stand a good chance of surviving. Asking for a tank that can take on the entire enemy team without dying is a little much. Even though we do already have Alistar and Rammus.

I wouldnt class Blitz under that has he doesn't have the same powerhouse crowd control of a Nautilus or a Leona. If you were building them like a traditional support (I hope), then they wont do much damage anyway.
